column2: P5JS - Animated Gif Collage - Part 3
What you'll do
Finally, we can start jamming together all sorts of gifs, and really go crazy!
Hi {{user_name}}, welcome back!

First things first - let's get back to the p5.js code editor. You can load your previous sketch (if you saved it at http://editor.p5js.org), or get back to where we left off: https://editor.p5js.org/madetohack/sketches/okIyaVEw
Last time we learned how to use the mouse click to control our gif with gif.play() and gif.pause().
Now let's fill our canvas with gifs!
To add a second gif we will repeat our previous steps, but this time with a new variable name.
At the top of our sketch we will add the line: let gif1;
This will create our variable gif1 to store our second gif
In the preload() function, add the line: gif1 = loadImage('url');
This time, replace the url with a second gif of your choosing.
Next, in draw(), we can display our gif with the following line: image(gif1, 200, 200);
This will display our new gif, named gif1, 200px to the right and 200 pixels down from the top of the screen.
Try changing these two numbers to move this gif around.
Next we will have to connect our play() and pause() functions to control gif1.
We can do this by adding: gif1.pause(); to our mousePressed() function, and by adding gif1.play(); to our mouseReleased() function.
You should be able to see both gifs play and pause with the mouse press.
Now, challenge yourself to fill your entire 600 by 600 canvas with gifs!
Remember, for each new gif you need to give it a unique name - like gif2, or gif3.
Also, try playing with the order in which your image() functions are called in draw(). This will determine how the gifs are stacked on top of each other.
Another fun thing to do is to have have some of the gifs play when the mouse is pressed while other gifs are paused. This creates a fun interactive effect!
Congratulations!  You have made your first GIF Collage!
